snippet: Even if the Palestinian Authority becomes a member of the court, the cases it plans to bring over the Gaza war last summer would face many hurdles.
abstract: Legal experts say even if Palestinians are successful in bid to join International Criminal Court, exacting legal repercussions for Israeli actions during war in Gaza are unlikely because court may not recognize actions as falling under its purview; bid to join court, however, is likely to result in profound repercussions for Palestinians, from both Israel and United States.

byline.contributor: Marlise Simons contributed reporting from Sydney, Australia.

lead_paragraph: Even if the Palestinian Authority becomes a member of the court, the cases it plans to bring over the Gaza war last summer would face many hurdles.

headline.main: Joining International Criminal Court Wouldn’t Guarantee Palestinians a War Crimes Case
headline.print_headline: Court Membership Wouldn’t Guarantee Palestinians a War Crimes Case

keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
keywords.name: subject
